page.title: 14A FERRET PET IN MILTON.
page.content: In towns,dogs,cats and fish may be kept as pets,but village home life is different.A boy in Milton has a pet ferret.It is thin like a weasel,it's {body}being 35cms long and it's tail 12cms,and it has creamy fur,a pointed {face}and pink{eyes.}A clean hutch in the garden is it's{home.}The owner,an 18 year old boy,{feeds}it bread and milk with a little meat.Ferrets are not suitable pets for young children because they can be{vicious. } This one is a good{rabbit hunter.}It is taken to the wood,muzzled and put down a rabbit warren.The ferret chases the rabbits and when one pops out a hole,the boy shoots it with his gun.He skins the poor rabbit and either feeds it to his dog or gets his mother to make it into rabbit stew.Sometimes a ferret will escape and become{wild.}It will then kill chickens and hens.
